trans-unit.source: How to annotate data sources
trans-unit.target: How to annotate data sources

trans-unit.source: How-to article highlighting how to annotate data assets in Azure Data Catalog, including friendly names, tags, descriptions, and experts.
trans-unit.target: How-to article highlighting how to annotate data assets in Azure Data Catalog, including friendly names, tags, descriptions, and experts.

trans-unit.source: How to annotate data sources
trans-unit.target: How to annotate data sources

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: **Microsoft Azure Data Catalog** is a fully managed cloud service that serves as a system of registration and system of discovery for enterprise data sources.
trans-unit.target: **Microsoft Azure Data Catalog** is a fully managed cloud service that serves as a system of registration and system of discovery for enterprise data sources.

trans-unit.source: In other words, **Azure Data Catalog** is all about helping people discover, understand, and use data sources, and helping organizations to get more value from their existing data.
trans-unit.target: In other words, **Azure Data Catalog** is all about helping people discover, understand, and use data sources, and helping organizations to get more value from their existing data.

trans-unit.source: When a data source is been registered with **Azure Data Catalog**, its metadata is copied and indexed by the service, but the story doesn’t end there.
trans-unit.target: When a data source is been registered with **Azure Data Catalog**, its metadata is copied and indexed by the service, but the story doesn’t end there.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Data Catalog** allows users to provide their own descriptive metadata – such as descriptions and tags – to supplement the metadata extracted from the data source, and to make the data source more understandable to more people.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Data Catalog** allows users to provide their own descriptive metadata – such as descriptions and tags – to supplement the metadata extracted from the data source, and to make the data source more understandable to more people.

trans-unit.source: Annotation and crowdsourcing
trans-unit.target: Annotation and crowdsourcing

trans-unit.source: Everyone has an opinion.
trans-unit.target: Everyone has an opinion.

trans-unit.source: And this is a good thing.
trans-unit.target: And this is a good thing.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Data Catalog** recognizes that different users have different perspectives on enterprise data sources, and that each of these perspectives can be valuable.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Data Catalog** recognizes that different users have different perspectives on enterprise data sources, and that each of these perspectives can be valuable.

trans-unit.source: Consider the following scenario:
trans-unit.target: Consider the following scenario:

trans-unit.source: The system administrator knows the service level agreement for the servers or services that host the data source.
trans-unit.target: The system administrator knows the service level agreement for the servers or services that host the data source.

trans-unit.source: The database administrator knows the backup schedule for each database, and the allowed ETL processing windows.
trans-unit.target: The database administrator knows the backup schedule for each database, and the allowed ETL processing windows.

trans-unit.source: The system owner knows the process for users to request access to the data source.
trans-unit.target: The system owner knows the process for users to request access to the data source.

trans-unit.source: The data steward knows how the assets and attributes in the data source map to the enterprise data model.
trans-unit.target: The data steward knows how the assets and attributes in the data source map to the enterprise data model.

trans-unit.source: The analyst knows how the data is used in the context of the business processes he supports.
trans-unit.target: The analyst knows how the data is used in the context of the business processes he supports.

trans-unit.source: Each of these perspectives is valuable, and **Azure Data Catalog** uses a crowdsourcing approach to metadata that allows each one to be captured and used to provide a complete picture of registered data sources.
trans-unit.target: Each of these perspectives is valuable, and **Azure Data Catalog** uses a crowdsourcing approach to metadata that allows each one to be captured and used to provide a complete picture of registered data sources.

trans-unit.source: Using the **Azure Data Catalog** portal, each user can add and edit his own annotations, while being able to view annotations provided by other users.
trans-unit.target: Using the **Azure Data Catalog** portal, each user can add and edit his own annotations, while being able to view annotations provided by other users.

trans-unit.source: Different types of annotations
trans-unit.target: Different types of annotations

trans-unit.source: During the **Azure Data Catalog** preview, the following types of annotations are supported:
trans-unit.target: During the **Azure Data Catalog** preview, the following types of annotations are supported:

trans-unit.source: Annotation
trans-unit.target: Annotation

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: Friendly name
trans-unit.target: Friendly name

trans-unit.source: Friendly names can be supplied at the data asset level, to make the data assets more easily understood.
trans-unit.target: Friendly names can be supplied at the data asset level, to make the data assets more easily understood.

trans-unit.source: Friendly names are most useful when the underlying object name is cryptic, abbreviated or otherwise not meaningful to users.
trans-unit.target: Friendly names are most useful when the underlying object name is cryptic, abbreviated or otherwise not meaningful to users.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Descriptions can be supplied at the data asset and attribute / column levels.
trans-unit.target: Descriptions can be supplied at the data asset and attribute / column levels.

trans-unit.source: Descriptions are free-form short text annotations that describe the user’s perspective on the data asset or its use.
trans-unit.target: Descriptions are free-form short text annotations that describe the user’s perspective on the data asset or its use.

trans-unit.source: Tags
trans-unit.target: Tags

trans-unit.source: Tags can be supplied at the data asset and attribute / column levels.
trans-unit.target: Tags can be supplied at the data asset and attribute / column levels.

trans-unit.source: Tags are user-defined labels that can be used to categorize data assets or attributes.
trans-unit.target: Tags are user-defined labels that can be used to categorize data assets or attributes.

trans-unit.source: Experts
trans-unit.target: Experts

trans-unit.source: Experts can be supplied at the data asset level.
trans-unit.target: Experts can be supplied at the data asset level.

trans-unit.source: Experts identify users or groups with expert perspectives on the data and can serve as points of contact for users who discover the registered data sources and have questions that are not answered by the existing annotations.
trans-unit.target: Experts identify users or groups with expert perspectives on the data and can serve as points of contact for users who discover the registered data sources and have questions that are not answered by the existing annotations.

trans-unit.source: Request access
trans-unit.target: Request access

trans-unit.source: Request access information can be supplied at the data asset level.
trans-unit.target: Request access information can be supplied at the data asset level.

trans-unit.source: This information is for users who discover a data source that they do not yet have permissions to access.
trans-unit.target: This information is for users who discover a data source that they do not yet have permissions to access.

trans-unit.source: Users can enter the email address of the user or group who grants access, the URL of the process or tool that users need to gain access, or can enter the process itself as text.
trans-unit.target: Users can enter the email address of the user or group who grants access, the URL of the process or tool that users need to gain access, or can enter the process itself as text.

trans-unit.source: Annotating multiple assets
trans-unit.target: Annotating multiple assets

trans-unit.source: When selecting multiple data assets in the **Azure Data Catalog** portal, users can annotate all selected assets in a single operation.
trans-unit.target: When selecting multiple data assets in the **Azure Data Catalog** portal, users can annotate all selected assets in a single operation.

trans-unit.source: Annotations will apply to all selected assets, making it easy to select and provide a consistent description and sets of tags and experts for related data assets.
trans-unit.target: Annotations will apply to all selected assets, making it easy to select and provide a consistent description and sets of tags and experts for related data assets.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Tags and experts can also be provided when registering data assets using the **Azure Data Catalog** data source registration tool.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Tags and experts can also be provided when registering data assets using the **Azure Data Catalog** data source registration tool.

trans-unit.source: When selecting multiple tables and views, only columns that all selected data assets have in common will be displayed in the **Azure Data Catalog** portal.
trans-unit.target: When selecting multiple tables and views, only columns that all selected data assets have in common will be displayed in the **Azure Data Catalog** portal.

trans-unit.source: This allows users to provide tags and descriptions for all columns with the same name for all selected assets.
trans-unit.target: This allows users to provide tags and descriptions for all columns with the same name for all selected assets.

trans-unit.source: Annotations and discovery
trans-unit.target: Annotations and discovery

trans-unit.source: Just as the metadata extracted from the data source during registration is added to the **Azure Data Catalog** search index, user-supplied metadata is also indexed.
trans-unit.target: Just as the metadata extracted from the data source during registration is added to the **Azure Data Catalog** search index, user-supplied metadata is also indexed.

trans-unit.source: This means that not only do annotations make it easier for users to understand the data they discover, annotations also make it easier for users to discover the annotated data assets by searching using the terms that make sense to them.
trans-unit.target: This means that not only do annotations make it easier for users to understand the data they discover, annotations also make it easier for users to discover the annotated data assets by searching using the terms that make sense to them.

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: Registering a data source with **Azure Data Catalog** makes that data discoverable by copying structural and descriptive metadata from the data source into the Catalog service.
trans-unit.target: Registering a data source with **Azure Data Catalog** makes that data discoverable by copying structural and descriptive metadata from the data source into the Catalog service.

trans-unit.source: Once a data source has been registered, users can provide annotations to make easier to discover and understand from within the **Azure Data Catalog** portal.
trans-unit.target: Once a data source has been registered, users can provide annotations to make easier to discover and understand from within the **Azure Data Catalog** portal.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
